IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: GLADE RUN FOUNDATION RAISES, MANAGES, INVESTS, RE-INVESTS AND DISTRIBUTES FUNDS FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE GLADE RUN NON-PROFIT SYSTEM (GLADE RUN LUTHERAN SERVICES AND GLADE RUN), DIRECTING ITS EFFORTS TO SOLICITING CONTRIBUTIONS FROM CORPORATIONS, FOUNDATIONS, GOVERNMENT AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC.
IRS990.MissionDesc: GLADE RUN FOUNDATION RAISES, MANAGES, INVESTS, RE-INVESTS, AND DISTRIBUTES FUNDS FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE GLADE RUN SYSTEM (GLADE RUN LUTHERAN SERVICES AND GLADE RUN), DIRECTING ITS EFFORTS TO SOLICITING CONTRIBUTIONS FROM CORPORATIONS, FOUNDATIONS, GOVERNMENT AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC.
IRS990.Desc: GLADE RUN FOUNDATION WAS ORGANIZED FOR THE PURPOSE OF RAISING, MANAGING, INVESTING, & DISTRIBUTING FUNDS FOR THE BENEFIT OF THEIR AFFILIATE PROGRAMS.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: GLADE RUN FOUNDATION OPERATES TOGETHER WITH TWO OTHER NONPROFIT CORPORATIONS: GLADE RUN(THE "PARENT") AND GLADE RUN LUTHERAN SERVICES (THE SERVICE CORPORATION"). THE PARENT HAS THE AUTHORITY TO APPOINT THE DIRECTORS OF THE FOUNDATION AND THE SERVICE CORPORATION, ALONG WITH APPROVING ALL ORGANIZATIONS' BUDGETS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOUNDATION MEETS REQUIREMENTS TO BE TREATED AS AN ORGANIZATION EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAX UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. MANAGEMENT BELIEVES THAT THERE IS NO LIABILITY RELATED TO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS AT JUNE 30, 2018. THE FOUNDATION IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO TAX EXAMINATIONS FOR YEARS BEFORE JUNE 30, 2015.

RecipientTable.NonCashAssistanceDesc: VARIOUS ITEMS INCLUDING EDUCATION SUPPLIES, CLOTHING, HOUSEHOLD ITEMS, ETC.
RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: THE PURPOSE OF ALL GRANTS WAS TO FUND THE EXEMPT PURPOSE SERVICES OF GLADE RUN LUTHERAN

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GLADE RUN LUTHERAN SERVICES MONITORS ALL GRANT FUNDS RECEIVED. BOTH THE FINANCE SERVICES DEPARTMENT AND THE GLADE RUN FOUNDATION EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR ENSURE THAT ANY GRANT FUNDS RECEIVED ARE USED FOR THE STATED PURPOSE AND IN THE APPROPRIATE TIME FRAME. GRANT FUNDING IS RECORDED IN BOTH THE FINANCIAL REPORTING SYSTEM AND THE FOUNDATION DONOR DATABASE,AND RECONCILED MONTHLY. ANY FUNDS RESTRICTED FOR PURPOSE OR THE PASSAGE OF TIME ARE RECORDED IN EXCEL SPREADSHEETS AND MONITORED AND UPDATED ON A MONTHLY BASIS. PRIOR TO ANY GRANT FUNDING BEING USED, THE PURCHASE OR USAGE IS CHECKED BY THE ASSISTANT DIRECTOR OF FINANCE, AND EITHER THE GLADE RUN FOUNDATION EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR OR PRESIDENT/CEO (UNDER CERTAIN CIRCUMSTANCES). MOST GRANT FUNDING HAS A PRE-APPROVED GRANT BUDGET THAT IS USED AS THE GUIDELINE FOR DETERMINING THE APPROPRIATENESS OF THE USAGE OF THE GRANT FUNDS. INTERIM AND FINAL GRANT REPORTS ARE PREPARED BY THE GLADE RUN FOUNDATION EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND THE ASSISTANT DIRECTOR OF FINANCE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS CONSISTS OF A MINIMUM OF SEVEN AND A MAXIMUM OF TWENTY ONE VOTING DIRECTORS, SEVEN OF WHOM SHALL BE ELECTED BY THE PARENT (GLADE RUN), AND UP TO FOURTEEN OF WHOM MAY BE ELECTED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, SUBJECT TO THE APPROVAL OF THE PARENT. THE PRESIDENT OF THE PARENT SHALL BE AN EX-OFFICIO, NON-VOTING DIRECTOR OF THE ORGANIZATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PARENT (GLADE RUN) SHALL HAVE THE FOLLOWING RIGHTS WITH RESPECT TO GLADE RUN LUTHERAN SERVICES AND GLADE RUN FOUNDATION: 1) ELECT AND REMOVE, WITH OR WITHOUT CAUSE, ALL DIRECTORS AND OFFICERS OF THE ORGANIZATION(S) 2) APPROVE ALL AMENDMENTS TO THE ORGANIZATION(S) ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION AND BYLAWS; 3) APPROVE ALL ORGANIZATION(S)' BUDGETS, BOTH OPERATING AND CAPITAL; 4) APPROVE EACH UNBUDGETED EXPENDITURE OF THE ORGANIZATION(S) IN EXCESS OF $50,000 AND ALL NEW PROGRAMS ESTABLISHED BY THE ORGANIZATION(S); 5) AND APPROVE ALL FUNDAMENTAL CHANGES WITH RESPECT TO THE ORGANIZATION(S) AS DESCRIBED IN CHAPTER 59 OF THE PENNSYLVANIA NONPROFIT CORPORATION LAW OF 1988, AS AMENDED FROM TIME TO TIME.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 RETURNS ARE DISTRIBUTED AND REVIEWED AT THE NEXT BOARD MEETING AFTER COMPLETION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GLADE RUN FOUNDATION IS PART OF A SYSTEM-WIDE COMPLIANCE PROGRAM. ALL STAFF ARE TRAINED AND GIVEN COMPLIANCE POLICIES AND PROCEDURES, AND ALL BOARD MEMBERS ARE INVOLVED IN THE COMPLIANCE PROGRAM. THE COMPLIANCE HOTLINE IS MONITORED DAILY BY A COMPLIANCE OFFICER.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GLADE RUN FOUNDATION DOES NOT EMPLOY ANY INDIVIDUALS, AND THEREFORE DOES NOT HAVE A PROCESS IN PLACE TO REVIEW COMPENSATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 18
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GLADE RUN FOUNDATION FILINGS ARE MADE AVAILABLE THROUGH THE GUIDESTAR WEBSITE (WWW.GUIDESTAR.ORG), AND ARE ALSO PROVIDED BY THE ORGANIZATION UPON REQUEST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GLADE RUN FOUNDATION FILINGS ARE MADE AVAILABLE THROUGH THE GUIDESTAR WEBSITE (WWW.GUIDESTAR.ORG), AND ARE ALSO PROVIDED BY THE ORGANIZATION UPON REQUEST.
OTHER FEES: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 0. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 0. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 228,298. TOTAL EXPENSES 228,298.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART XII, FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND REPORTING
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THERE WERE NO CHANGES TO THE AUDIT OVERSIGHT PROCEDURES DURING 2017-2018.

IdDisregardedEntitiesGrp.PrimaryActivitiesTxt: HOLDS OIL, GAS AND MINERAL RIGHTS RELATED TO LAND OWNED BY THE FOUNDATION

IdRelatedTaxExemptOrgGrp.PrimaryActivitiesTxt: OVERSEE, COORDINATE, REPRESENT, AND SET POLICY OF THE AFFILIATED SYSTEM.
SOCIAL SERVICES AGENCY FOR THE WELL BEING OF CHILDREN, YOUTH, AND FAMILIES
